landmarks.name: Henry Fowler blue plaque!!Henry Hartley Fowler PC GCSI LLD Viscount Wolverhampton 1830-1911 Lord President of the Council 1908-1910 First Freeman of Wolverhampton 1892 MP for Wolverhampton 1880-1908 worked on this site

W. G. R. Sprague, John Gielgud, and Queen's Theatre black plaque!!Queen's Theatre Built by W. G. R. Sprague, the Queen's Theatre opened in 1908 with a comedy The Sugar Bowl. While the Edwardian interior has largely survived, the theatre suffered bomb damage during the last war, re-opening in 1959 with the present exterior and John Gielgud in The Ages of Man
Charles II black plaque!!Charles II on his ride to the coast after the Battle of Worcester, stopped to take ale at this inn. Tuesday, October 14th 1651

Gold Hill, Shaftesbury and Alfred the Great blue plaque!!Gold Hill An artist's impression of a busy market day at the top of Gold Hill before the current Town Hall was built in 1827. The main features still in place are Shaftesbury Abbey precinct wall on the right together with the Sun and Moon Inn just below the church
William Morris blue plaque!!William Morris, later Lord Nuffield (1877-1963), carmaker and philanthropist, lived and built bicycles here (1896-1903)

first postmarks in the world and General Letter Office blue plaque!!Near this spot the General Letter Office stood in Post House Yard 1653-1666 Here were struck in 1661 the first postmarks in the world

Bram Stoker green plaque!!Dracula and Carfax House. 1897 Bram Stoker's novel 'Dracula'. Dracula moves to Carfax House at Purfleet on a bye road to London. Probably based on Purfleet House built by Samuel Whitbread, now the site of St

John Wesley green plaque!!Revd John Wesley MA first preached in Kendal on Monday 9th April 1753 in a large convenient room where Mr Ingham's society used to meet. A Methodist society was later formed and met in the Old Play House in the Market Place
Peter Sellers blue plaque!!Peter Sellers 1925-1980 Goon and comic actor lived here 1936-1940
Laurel Aitken blue plaque!!Laurel Aitken 1925-2005 the Legendary Godfather of Ska lived here
Sarah Fuller Flower Adams blue plaque!!Sarah Flower Adams 1905-1848 authoress of the hymn "Nearer my God to Thee" was born here
James Scott blue plaque!!Following defeat at the Battle of Sedgemoor in 1685 The Duke of Monmouth was held in this house prior to his execution in the Tower of London
Henrietta Barnett plaque!!Dame Henrietta Barnett, D.B.E., founder of The Hampstead Garden Suburb, lived here, 1915 - 1936.
John Wesley blue plaque!!Near this spot John Wesley preached several times between 1745 and 1752 and established the first Wesleyan chapel in Staffordshire on this site.
Edward Pellew black plaque!!Admiral Sir Edward Pellew Bart 1st viscount Exmouth 1757 - 1833 Lived here from ca. 1765 - 1770

Gideon Mantell blue plaque!!Dr. Gideon A. Mantell F.R.S. surgeon and geologist born in Lewes 1790, died in London 1852 lived here he discovered the fossil bones of the prehistoric iguanodon in the Sussex Weald
Thomas Paine blue plaque!!Thomas Paine 1737-1809 here expounded his revolutionary politics. This inn is regarded as a cradle of American independence which he helped to found with pen and sword.
Jack Holt blue plaque!!Jack Holt O.B.E. 1912-1995. A great small boat designer, who brought back sailing to the people. Jack was a member of this club and sailed his solo here.

Simon de Montfort grey plaque!!Battle of Lewes 1264 On 14th May 1264 Simon de Montfort's army of 5000 Barons and Londoners defeated royalist forces of twice that size under Henry III on the Downs northwest of Lewes

George Parker Bidder brown plaque!!"The Calculating Boy" George Parker Bidder 1806-78 President of the Institution of Civil Engineers 1860-61 A child prodigy who was born nearby and became a distinguished engineer

Peter Mark Roget blue plaque!!Peter Mark Roget 1779-1869 Physician and compiler of the Thesaurus Co-founder of Manchester's Medical School

William Turner stone plaque!!In this house was born on the 7th day of January 1832 Sir William Turner, K.C.B., F.R.S., D.Sc., LL.D., D.C.L., Knight of the Royal Prussian Order, Pour-le-Mérite, Professor in and Principal and Vice-Chancellor of Edinburgh University.
Laurence Binyon plaque!!Laurence Binyon, Poet & Scholar, 1869-1943, was born at No. 1 High Street on 10th August 1869

Siege of Sidney Street and Charles Pearson red and black plaque!!In memory of District Officer Charles Pearson of the London Fire Brigade who died from injuries received at 100 Sidney Street near this site during the Siege of Sidney Street on 3rd January 1911
Edward Frankland and John Ambrose Fleming green plaque!!Sir Edward Frankland FRS 1825-1899, Chemist & Sir John Ambrose Fleming FRS 1849-1945, Physicist Worshipped here in their youth.
Charles Edward Stuart black plaque!!Bonnie Prince Charlie was proclaimed Regent by the Jacobite Army near here 24 November 1745

George Emlyn Williams blue plaque!!(George) Emlyn Williams CBE 1905-1987 Actor and Playwright lived here 1930-1934

Thomas Edmondson stone plaque!!In a house on this site was born on the 30th June 1792 Thomas Edmondson inventor of the Railway Ticket Dating Press & Printing Machinery (1837-40). Died in Manchester 22nd June 1851.

Samuel Pepys brown plaque!!St James's Church. A Georgian church on a medieval site. St. Mary's Nunnery church was built here in the 12th century. Henry VIII closed the nunnery in 1539, but the church continued as Clerkenwell parish church

Richard Gillow and Custom House, Lancaster green plaque!!Former Custom House built 1764 to the designs of Richard Gillow.
Robert Baden-Powell brushed metal plaque!!Robert Baden-Powell O.M. 1st Baron of Gilwell and Freeman of the Borough of Poole Founder of the Scout Movement Poole - where it all began
Augustus John blue plaque!!Augustus John R.A., O.M. (1878 - 1961) Artist Lived at Alderney Manor (dem) 1910 - 27 and drew inspiration from the Quay.

Eric Portman blue plaque!!Eric Portman 1903-1969 Stage and screen actor was born at 20. Chester Road, Akroydon, Halifax

William Marsden bronze plaque!!William Marsden (1796-1867) was born in a house close to this site in August 1796. As a young man, he left Sheffield to study at St. Bartholomew's Hospital and was admitted a member of the Royal College of Surgeons in 1827

John Brown bronze plaque!!John Brown John Brown (1816-1896), one of the greatest of the Victorian industrialist, was born in Orchard Square, in what was then Favell's Yard. Richard Gillow, Henry Fell, and Samuel Simpson green plaque!!1 & 3 Cable Street built c.1759 for Captain Henry Fell and Samuel Simpson. Richard Gillow architect

Thomas Wolsey blue plaque!!The Palace of the Archbishops of York The Palace was built in the 14th and 15th centuries as the residence of the Archbishops of York. It was refurbished by Cardinal Wolsey, Archbishop of York 1514-30, Lord Chancellor to King Henry VIII

William Friese-Greene white plaque!!This tablet was placed here on June 21 1939 by the proprietors of the Orpheus cinema Bristol as a tribute to the genius of their fellow citizen William Friese-Greene, the inventor of kinematography, and to mark the fiftieth anniversary of his patent guaranteed by the British Patent Office June 21 1889
Yuri Gagarin black plaque!!Yuri Gagarin 1934 - 1968 Soviet Cosmonaut and first human to voyage into space Flew into Manchester Airport to be greeted by thousands of supporters 12th July 1961

William Friese-Greene bronze plaque!!Born here 7 September 1855 William Friese-Greene The pioneer of Cinematography This commemoration plaque was unveiled by the Lord Mayor of Bristol, Ald
Adam Sedgwick brass plaque!!Adam Sedgwick one of founders of British Geology was born here in the Old Parsonage in 1785.

Southwell railway station blue plaque!!The Southwell Railway Southwell was connected to the Midland Railway network by a short branch-line on the 1st July 1847 but there was no regular passenger service by steam locomotives until 1860

Ted Ray green plaque!!THE CROSS ROADS MILNTHORPE. The Cross Roads were created in 1922-1924 when the east side of Church Street and the west end of Main Street were cleared away to straighten the A6 road
Paul Hogarth green plaque!!Paul Hogarth, RA, artist and writer, was born in this house in 1917. He was the son of a Westmorland hill farmer at Lowgill. He trained at Manchester and at St

Edward VII, The Unicorn Hotel, Ripon, and Robert Collinson green plaque!!The Unicorn Hotel. This ancient coaching inn was much used for meetings and entertainments in Georgian times, and was later patronised by Edward VII when Prince of Wales
Operation Overlord grey plaque!!OPERATION OVERLORD On the 5th June 1944 over 300 craft left the quays of Poole for the Normandy Landings
Charles II and James Scott brass plaque!!King Charles II and the unfortunate Duke of Monmouth dined at the house formerly standing on this site 15 September A.D. 1665

James Wyatt and Town Hall, Ripon green plaque!!The Town Hall This building, housing public assembly and reading rooms, was designed by James Wyatt in 1798. The Corporation met here in the 19th century and in 1897 the Marquess of Ripon gave it to the City as the Town Hall.
George VI green plaque!!THE PLAYING FIELD. In 1900 Maurice Bromley-Wilson of Dallam Tower 'made over the Strands Meadow to the village for use as a playing field at a nominal rent'
John Bankes and Ralph Bankes marble plaque!!Sir John Bankes Kt of Corfe Castle 1589 - 1644 Lord Chief Justice of England Father of Sir Ralph Bankes Kt MP who built Kingston Lacy in 1660

Joseph Hunter plaque!!1783 1861 Joseph Hunter He was born 6 February 1783 in a house on the north side of New Church Street which was demolished to make way for the 1897 Town Hall

George III, Elizabeth Percy, and Hugh Percy green plaque!!The First Duke of Northumberland. The first Duke of Northumberland was born here in 1712. Formerly Sir Hugh Smithson, he married Lady Elizabeth Percy & succeeded her father as Earl of Northumberland in 1750
James Fowler blue plaque!!James Fowler FRIBA 1828-1892 Architect & Diocesan Surveyor Mayor of Louth 5 times lived here 1869-1892

William Collins blue plaque!!The Poet William Collins was born on this site 25 December 1721 and died in the Cathedral Cloisters 12 June 1759 How sleep the Brave, who sink to Rest By all their Country's Wishes blest!

George Webster green plaque!!The KENDAL LANCASTER CANAL. This canal, completed in 1819, brought coal into Kendal from Lancashire and carried out limestone and manufactured goods. By providing cheap coal to replace water power with steam power it enabled Kendal's manufacturing industry to expand, the Kendal yards then developing as workshops and workers' housing

Francis Webster, William Bindloss, and Agnes Bindloss green plaque!!KENDAL TOWN HALL. On this site once stood White Hall, believed to have been an exchange hall for Kendal's cloth trade with Virginia. It was replaced in 1825 by a new White Hall designed by Kendal architect Francis Webster and incorporating a billiards room, newsroom, lecture hall and ballroom
Edmund Kean green plaque!!THE SHAKESPEARE THEATRE. Kendal's first purpose-built theatre, designed by local architect John Richardson, was opened at the top of this yard in 1829
George Romney black plaque!!Here lived for a time and died George Romney portrait painter. Born at Dalton in Furness 1734. Died 1802.

Cuthbert Brodrick, Joshua Major, and Charles Darwin blue plaque!!Wells House Designed by Cuthbert Brodrick, the celebrate architect of Leeds Town Hall. Landscaped by Joshua Major. Opened in 1856 as a Hydro, offering water treatments and pure Ilkley air
Isaac Wilkinson slate plaque!!Isaac Wilkinson c1704 - 1784 practical metallurgist and inventor. British ironmakers profitably gained from his inventions. Foundryman Backbarrow Iron Company

Charles I blue plaque!!Charles I and the Civil War On the 5th May 1646 at 7.00 a.m. Charles I arrived at 'The King's Head' from Stamford, disguised as a clergyman. Here he spent his last hours of freedom before being taken to Kelham to the Scottish Army Commander

George Webster, Francis Webster, and Miles Thompson white plaque!!WEBSTER'S YARD. This name Webster commemorates Kendal's most distinguished architects. Francis Webster and his son George. In 1788 Francis Webster joined a local mason in premises in this yard
Miles Thompson green plaque!!SANDES HOSPITAL. In this yard, Thomas Sandes (1606 - 81), cloth merchant and former Mayor of Kendal, founded a school and eight almshouses for poor widows
Christopher Hatton blue plaque!!Originally the house of Sir Christopher Hatton a favourite of Queen Elizabeth I and after 1619 was the home of the Bradshaw family
John Rennie blue plaque!!Wyre Aqueduct - John Rennie designed this single span aqueduct, built in 1797. It is 110 feet long and carries the Lancaster to Kendal canal 34 feet above the River Wyre.
Harford Jones-Brydges blue plaque!!The birthplace of Sir Harford Jones Brydges 1764-1847 British Ambassador to the court of Persia 1807-1811

George Webster green plaque!!THE NATIONAL SCHOOL. The School was designed by George Webster and was built and run by public subscription. It opened to boys in 1819 for their "education in Religious Knowledge and useful learning"

The Old Court House blue plaque!!Medieval Borough-owned property dating in parts from the 13th century. By the 19th century it had become known as THE OLD COURT HOUSE as a back room was used to elect the Mayor, Constables, Hayward, Bailiff and Aletaster

Spence Broughton blue plaque!!Broughton Lane / Attercliffe Common. Spence Broughton the highwayman, was hung in chains near here in 1796 close to the scene of his crime. He is thought to be the last man in England to be so punished.
John Wesley stone plaque!!John Wesley July 15th 1779 "I preached in Paradise Square in Sheffield to the largest congregation I ever saw on a weekday ".

John Dalton green plaque!!1766 John Dalton 1844 John Dalton. A Cumberland man worked in Manchester from 1792 until his death. He made many advances in meteorology, the physics and chemistry of gases and the theory of combustion
David Daniel Davis stone plaque!!1778 1841 David Daniel Davis Physician Lived in this house 1803-1812 Translated Pinel's Treatise on Insanity Assisted at the birth of Queen Victoria

Associated Society of Locomotive Engineers and Firemen blue plaque!!A.S.L.E. & F. The Associated Society of Locomotive Engineers and Firemen was founded in 1880. Ralph Thoresby blue plaque!!Ralph Thoresby FRS (1658-1725) The historian of Leeds had his home and museum here.

Tom Hadaway plaque!!Tom Hadaway 1923-2005

Alliott Verdon Roe, Humphrey Verdon Roe, and Avro blue plaque!!Alliott Verdon Roe (1877-1958) and Humphrey Verdon Roe (1879-1949) formed the A. V. Roe & Co (Avro) aircraft company on 1st January 1910 and opened their first workshop here.
Roald Dahl blue plaque!!Roald Dahl 1916-1990 Children's author Attended the former St Peter's School on this site
Ralph Allen bronze plaque!!Ralph Allens' Cottages Built by Ralph Allen to house his stone masons who worked nearby Erected circa 1740 Restored 1983
William Herschel bronze plaque!!Here lived William Herschel A.D. 1781.

Edward Bury bronze plaque!!Edward Bury Between 1852 and 1860 Hillsborough Hall was occupied by the family of Manchester born Edward Bury F.R.S. (1794-1858), pioneer locomotive builder with the London and Birmingham Railway (1838-1846), one-time locomotive superintendent and general manager of the Great Northern Railway, and subsequently co-founder of Sheffield steel firm Bedford, Burys and Co, of the Regent Works

Samuel Osborn bronze plaque!!Samuel Osborn Samuel Osborn (1826-1891) was one of the city's greatest industrialists, becoming Master Cutler in 1873 and Lord Mayor in 1890. The plaque marks the site of his company's Clyde Works, purchased in 1868 from Shortridge Howell and Co

John Bright blue plaque!!Carbrook Hall, Attercliffe Common. Carbrook Hall was once a much larger house, this wing being added in 1620. Here lived Colonel John Bright, famed for his part in the taking of Sheffield Castle by Parliament in the Civil War.

Archibald Leitch and John Street Stand red plaque!!1901 The world famous Archibald Leitch John Street Stand, a landmark in football, opens

William Douglas white plaque!!This edifice successively the property of the Cross Church, the Hans Lord Yester Earls of Tweeddale, the Douglases Earls of March and the Fourth Duke of Queensberry, was finally acquired by William Chambers and for purposes of social improvement presented by him as a free gift yo his native town 1857

Madge Gill blue plaque!!Madge Gill, née Maud Eades artist (1882-1961) lived here between 1882-1890
John Macadam black plaque!!Church Street Milnthorpe. Church Street led to St Peter's Church in Heversham, Milnthorpe's main place of worship before St Thomas' Church was built in 1837
Robert Louis Stevenson blue plaque!!Robert Louis Stevenson 1850-1894 author lived here
John Brown white plaque!!Atlas Works (1854) From these offices was once controlled the John Brown industrial empire at its height employing 55,000 in coal, steel and ship building

Richard Norman Shaw, Frederick Goodall, and W. S. Gilbert blue plaque!!This house designed by R. Norman Shaw Architect, for Frederick Goodall Painter was later the home of W. S. Gilbert Writer and librettist

John Paul Jones bronze plaque!!Commodore John Paul Jones. Illustrious naval hero of the American Revolution. Born here July 6, 1747

E. Phillips Oppenheim plaque!!E Phillips Oppenheim Novelist, 1866-1946
Joseph Merrick brown plaque!!Joseph Carey Merrick son of Leicester 1862-1890 A true model of bravery & dignity for all peoples, of all generations.

David Thompson green plaque!!David Thompson 1770-1857 explored and mapped Canada studied at this school 1777-1784
Lawrence Wright blue plaque!!Lawrence Wright, composer and publisher of popular songs 1888-1964. Opposite this site at 29 Lower Conduit Street the Wright Music Co. was established in 1906
C. P. Snow blue plaque!!C.P. Snow, author and scientist, 1905-1980. Lord Snow of Leicester was born at 40 Richmond Road opposite this plaque

Thomas Attwood blue plaque!!Thomas Attwood 1783-1856 political reformer lived in a house on this site
Joseph Chamberlain plaque!!Joseph Chamberlain
Agatha Christie and Max Mallowan blue plaque!!Dame Agatha Christie 1890-1976 author lived here 1934-76 with her husband Sir Max Mallowan 1904-1978 archaeologist
Thomas Bray blue plaque!!The Old Rectory. Thomas Bray lived here 1690-1729

Edward White Benson blue plaque!!Edward White Benson Archbishop of Canterbury 1883 - 1896 was born in a house on this site
John Baskerville brass plaque!!John Baskerville 1706-1775 printer, publisher and founder of the Baskerville Press lived in a house formerly standing on this site
Granville Bantock blue plaque!!Sir Granville Bantock 1868-1946 composer, lived here 1926-1933
Edward Burne-Jones blue plaque!!Sir Edward Burne-Jones 1833-1898 artist born in a house on this site

Thomas Hall green plaque!!Thomas Hall B.D. Schoolmaster, Preacher, Bibliophile taught here from 1629 to 1662.

John Freeth blue plaque!!John Freeth the Birmingham Poet of Bell Street 1731-1808

Charles Edward Stuart white plaque!!Prince Charlie's House This building dates from the year 1603. In 1745 'Bonnie' Prince Charlie established his headquarters here during the siege of Carlisle on November 12th to 18th 1745.
William Morris blue plaque!!Site of the William Morris Printworks Here stood the Merton Abbey works of William Morris, established in 1881 in buildings used for calico printing since 1752

Henry Cort blue plaque!!Henry Cort 1740 - 1800 Ironmaster, who invented the Puddling Process for making wrought iron at his foundry on Gosport Green, near this site.

Charles Lamb plaque!!Elia. To the immortal memory of Charles Lamb. Perhaps the most loved name in English literature who was a Bluecoat Boy here for 7 years. B: 1775 D: 1834

Godfrey Thomson grey plaque!!The University of Edinburgh In Honour of Sir Godfrey Thomson 1881-1955 Pioneer of Educational Testing, Bell Professor of Education, Director of Moray House College (1925-51)

Eric Treacy slate plaque!!Railway photographer, Pastor to railwaymen, lover of life and railways. This plaque was erected to commemorate the Right Reverend Eric Treacy MBE LLD Lord Bishop of Wakefield 1968-1976 who died on Appleby Station 13 May 1978

Thomas Hardy and John Hicks stone plaque!!Thomas Hardy. O.M. Poet and novelist. (Born at Bockhampton 2 June 1840, died at Max Gate, Dorchester, 11 January 1928.) worked here 1856-1862 as pupil to John Hicks, architect

John Meade Falkner black plaque!!Home of John Meade Falkner (1858-1932) bibliophile and author

Tomkyns Hilgrove Turner grey plaque!!Sir Tomkyns Hilgrove Turner 1764-1843 General, Governor of the Bermudas and Lieutenant-Governor of Jersey lived here. Delivered the Rosetta Stone from Egypt to the British Museum.

FitzRoy Somerset black plaque!!Lord Raglan The Lord Raglan is one of the oldest tavern sites in the City. The house was originally known as The Bush. It then became "The Lord Raglan" to commemmorate Lord Fitzroy Somerset who became 1st Baron Raglan in 1852
Charles Kingsley blue plaque!!In 1864 Livermead House was the home of Charles Kingsley (1819 - 1875) clergyman, naturalist & author of 'The Water Babies'

Thomas Hardy black plaque!!Admiral Thomas Hardy 05 April 1769 - 20 September 1839 Hardy was born on 5th April 1769 in Portisham, Dorset. He first entered the navy in 1781 on board the brig, HMS Helena

William IV bronze plaque!!This statue stood formerly in King William Street in the City of London where it was set up in 1845. It was removed to this site and presented to H M Office of Works by the Corporation of the City of London in 1936

George Webster green plaque!!THE BANK OF WESTMORLAND. Founded on wealth generated by Kendal's textile trade the bank opened in 1833 and moved to this site in 1835. Robert Whitehead brushed metal plaque!!A Tribute to Robert Whitehead (1823-1905) A member of the Whitehead family of Bury he invented the torpedo. His daughter Agatha von Trapp was the grandmother of the children whose escapades were featured in the film 'The Sound of Music'
Robert Grosvenor blue plaque!!The medieval New Inn, later the Red Lion, was a posting inn on the Great West Road. Bought by Earl Grosvenor in 1820 and renamed the Grosvenor Arms.
J. R. R. Tolkien blue plaque!!J. R. R. Tolkien author of The Lord of the Rings convalesced here (then Brooklands Officers' Hospital) 1917-1918 during his service in the Great War

Henry Irving blue plaque!!Birthplace of Sir Henry Irving 1838-1905 the first actor to be knighted

Helen Allingham blue plaque!!Helen M. E. Allingham 1848-1926 watercolour artist. Her family lived in the area 1849-1862. She married Irish poet W. Allingham 1874. Elected first woman member Royal Watercolour Society 1875

Hadrian's Wall bronze plaque!!Hadrian's Wall. Within this plot, covered by red concrete stand the lower courses of the south face of Hadrian's wall built first in A.D. 122 from Newcastle Upon Tyne to Bowness on Solway, and afterwards extended to Wallsend, a distance in all of 80 Roman miles

Biggin Hill Royal Air Force station blue plaque!!Site of Biggin Hill Royal Air Force station 1917-1992

Surrey Iron Railway brass plaque!!The Surrey Iron Railway. Opened in 1803, ran from Wandsworth to West Croydon, and had a branch from Mitcham that terminated in this Borough in 1804. It was the first public railway in the world, was horse-drawn, carried only freight, and operated until 1816

William III blue plaque!!To commemorate the landing of King William III at this pier on 14th. June 1690

Hamilton Harty blue plaque!!Sir Hamilton Harty 1879-1941 Musician and Composer lived here

Ruby Murray white plaque!!Ruby Murray (March 29, 1935 - December 17, 1996) was a popular singer born in Moltke Street and brought up in the Village. Her characteristic hoarse voice was a result of an operation on her throat in early childhood
Jane Austen blue plaque!!Pyne House. This is the most likely lodging of Jane Austen, whose visits to Lyme in 1803 and 1804 gave birth to her novel "Persuasion"

John Turner green plaque!!1 King Street Sir John Turner (1632-1712) merchant lived here. Mayor 1678 & 1692, M.P. for Lynn, patron of Henry Bell, architect. The Custom House and Duke's Head Hotel were built for him.

Frances Burney green plaque!!St Margaret's Vicarage Built c.1830 for a Lynn merchant, this house has been the Vicarage since 1912. From the previous house on this site novelist Fanny Burney (1752-1840) observed the social life of Lynn, staying there as a regular visitor.

William Blake blue plaque!!William Blake 1757-1827 poet, painter, visionary was arrested, in 1803, in this doorway after allegedly making seditious remarks to a soldier billeted at The Fox Inn

Walter Raleigh and Raleigh's Seat white plaque!!Raleigh's Seat Sir Walter Raleigh built this stone seat into the wall beside the road so he could sit here and look over his gardens, while at the same time keeping an eye on the traffic

William Perry slate plaque!!Sir William Perry Born on the site of this house 26 May 1623 Buried Romsey Abbey 24 December 1687 Anatomist, Economist, Cartographer, Designer Founder Member, The Royal Society

Ryder Cup plaque!!Host City to The Ryder Cup 2010
Frank Matcham green plaque!!Frank Matcham (1854-1920) theatre architect designed this theatre

A highly influential forum for the avant-garde in politics, philosophy, art and literature met here from 1908. Vladimir Lenin blue plaque!!Vladimir Ilyich Lenin 1870-1924 Founder of the USSR Lived here in 1908

Guy Gibson white plaque!!Wing Commmander Guy Gibson VC DSO & Bar DFC & Bar was leader of the famous 617 'Dam Buster' squadron which was formed in 1943 for the specific task of breaching the Moehne and Eder dams in Germany

Guy Gibson bronze plaque!!In honour of Wing Commander Guy Penrose Gibson VC, DSO & Bar, DFC & Bar. Officer commanding 617 Squadron Bomber Command Royal Air Force later known as the Dambusters, who carried out the daring and successful bombing raid on the German dams of the Ruhr in 1943

Thomas Hardy blue plaque!!Church Hall, Abbey Street. Dating from 1636, this Jacobian-style building housed the Crewkerne Grammar School founded by John de Combe in 1499. Captain Thomas Hardy, Nelson's flag-captain, was a pupil here
William McEwan bronze plaque!!The University of Edinburgh In honour of William McEwan 1827 - 1913. MP, Founder of McEwan's Brewery, Benefactor of the Medical School and Graduation Hall

John Patch blue plaque!!Southfield House, Middle Path. John Patch, noted Crewkerne builder and architect, built this house for himself on land purchased in 1837. His characteristic style may be seen in many of the town's buildings of the 1830's and 1840's.
Francis Nicholson blue plaque!!Francis Nicholson 1753-1844 Artist and printmaker. Father of English watercolour painting. Lived in Hungate.

Charles I, Henry Stuart, Elizabeth Stuart, James II, and 1 other!!Site of The Greyhound Inn Where in July 1647 King Charles I met his children James, Duke of York, Henry, Duke of Gloucester and Princess Elizabeth. This was arranged by the Parliamentary leader, Sir Thomas Fairfax

George Pulman blue plaque!!The Hermitage This 18th Century house was the home between 1863 and 1878 of George Pulman, eminent local historian, author of the Book of the Axe and pioneer of local newspapers.

Matthew Boulton and Assay Office, Birmingham bronze plaque!!Birmingham Assay Office. Since the 14th century in Britain articles of silver and gold have had to be tested at an assay office for metal purity standard and there hallmarked to protect the customer from fraud
Charles II, George Inn, Bridport, and 9 East Street white plaque!!The Old George Inn. King Charles II came here September 23 1651.
William Penn blue plaque!!William Penn, Quaker born on Tower Hill baptised in All Hallows Church 23rd Oct 1644 founder of Pennsylvania

William Penn and Gulielma Maria Springett marble plaque!!Here William Penn (1644-1718) Quaker Statesman and Man of Vision, Founder of Pennsylvania and Planner of Philadelphia, Friend of the Indians, Crusader for Civil and Religious Liberty, Designer of European Peace, resided for five years after his marriage to Gulielma Maria Springett (1644-1694) The stone above this tablet from Pennsbury, Pennsylvania, the ancient home of William Penn on the Delaware River, was presented by the Pennsylvania Historical and Museum Commission who are the custodians of the property.
John Wesley blue plaque!!John Wesley the founder of Methodism preached on this site 15th April 1790.

William Penn white plaque!!Near this site William Penn and William Mead were tried in 1670 for preaching to an unlawful assembly in Grace Church Street. Fred Fox blue plaque!!3 Lyme Road. Private Fred Fox DCM, MM&Bar, Medaille Militaire, lived here. He served in the 15 th Hussars and the East Surrey Regiment and was one of the most decorated private soldiers of the First World War.
John Betjeman blue plaque!!9 Church Street. This grand 18th Century Town House, much admired by Poet Laureate John Betjeman, housed the Local Council offices until they moved to the Town Hall in 1995

Thomas Hutchins blue plaque!!The George Hotel, Market Square. This Georgian hotel is the most complete survival of Crewkerne's coaching inns. Thomas Hutchins, the proprietor and Crewkerne's Postmaster between 1619 and 1631, introduced England's first profitable postal service between London and Plymouth.

Maud Burnett blue plaque!!Dame Annie Maud Burnett. b. 1863-1950 d. lived here. Elected in 1910, she was the first and only woman member of Tynemouth Council until 1929 when three others were elected

Robert Edwin Phillips white plaque!!Commemorating West Bromwich-born Capt. Robert Edwin Phillips, V.C. 1895-1968 Awarded the Victoria Cross during the First World War
Robert Edwin Phillips blue plaque!!Captain Robert Edwin Phillips VC (1895-1968) Royal Warwickshire Regiment Born in West Bromwich Awarded the Victoria Cross 1917
Frank Matcham blue plaque!!Frank Matcham (1854-1920) theatre architect designed this theatre
John Nevison and Darcy Fletcher stone plaque!!Here Nevison killed Fletcher, 1684

Violet Vanbrugh and Irene Vanbrugh blue plaque!!This plaque commemorates stage and screen stars Violet and Irene Vanbrugh. Violet (1867-1942) was born in a house near this site, her sister Dame Irene (1872-1949) at Heavitree Vicarage.
Gustav Holst red plaque!!Gustav Holst 1874-1934 composer and lecturer taught here 1920-1923

Henry Trigg blue plaque!!The coffin of Henry Trigg. High up in the roof of this building rests a coffin which at one time contained the body of Henry Trigg. His will (1724) specified that his body was to be 'decently laid there, upon a floor in the roof'
George Chapman blue plaque!!Here lived George Chapman poet, playwright and translator. 1559-1634

Thomas Lea and Slingfield Mill blue plaque!!Slingfield Mill was built in 1864 by Thomas Lea. The architects were Lockwood and Mawson of Bradford, well known for their textile mills. Frank Freeman, Wynn Freeman, Captain Beefheart, Fleetwood Mac, and 1 other!!Frank Freeman ran The Dancing Club here with his wife Wynn. Between 1968-1971 many famous groups played here such as Captain Beefheart, Fleetwood Mac and Tyrannosaurus Rex

Ellen Terry, Charles Wyndham, and Queen's Theatre, Long Acre black plaque!!Queen's Theatre The old Queen's Theatre occupied this site for just eleven years from 1867 to 1878 and was renowned in its day, albeit fleetingly, for the distinguished players, including Ellen Terry and Charles Wyndham, who trod its boards
Alec Guinness film cell plaque!!Sir Alec Guinness In recognition of his unique contribution to British Cinema

Charles Darwin blue plaque!!Hillside. Charles Darwin & family stayed here (Wells Terrace) while awaiting the publication of 'On the Origin of Species' in autumn 1859. In the 20th century it became St Winifred's Maternity Home.
Rosa Lewis green plaque!!Rosa Lewis 1867-1952 Chef de cuisine and hotelier dramatised as 'The Duchess of Duke Street' ruled the Cavendish hotel in a building on this site
Germaine Necker blue plaque!!1813-1814 Germaine Necker Baronne de Staël-Holstein Lived in a house on this site during the last of her ten years of exile

Don Arden, Small Faces, Steve Marriott, Ronnie Lane, and 3 other!!Impresario Don Arden and mod band "Small Faces" (Steve Marriott, Ronnie Lane, Kenney Jones, Ian McLagan and Jimmy Winston) worked here 1965-1967

John Snow blue plaque!!Dr John Snow (1813-1858) Founding father of Epidemiology. In 1854 his research linked deaths to the water pump near this site and thus determined that cholera is a water borne disease
Peter Cook green plaque!!Peter Cook 1937-1995 comedian and "only twin" co-founded and ran the Establishment Club here 1961-1964
Josiah Wedgwood blue plaque!!Josiah Wedgwood F.R.S. Master Potter (1730-95) here had his London showrooms 1774-1795
Frederick Winsor green plaque!!Frederick Winsor 1763-1830 gave the world's first demonstration of street lighting by coal gas, from a retort located here June 1807

Herbert Beerbohm Tree green plaque!!This theatre was founded in 1897 by Herbert Tree actor & directed by him until his death 1917

John Vanbrugh and C. J. Phipps black plaque!!Her Majesty's Theatre In 1705 Sir John Vanbrugh built the first of four theatres on this famous site. Freddie Welsh blue plaque!!World Champion Lightweight Boxer (1914-17) trained here. Freddie Welsh (Frederick Hall Thomas) 1886-1927. Bu Pencampwr Bocsio Pwysau Ysgafn y Byd (1914-17) yn hyfforddi yma
Henry Cavendish grey plaque!!Hon. Henry Cavendish natural philosopher lived here born 1731 died 1810

H. E. Bates blue plaque!!H. E. Bates author lived here 1914-22

Hannah Cowley blue plaque!!Hannah Cowley 1743-1809 Playwright, poet, pioneer champion of women's rights, lived here from 1801. Hannah, who was born in Tiverton, was a leading playwright of her day, her first play being produced by David Garrick at Drury Lane
George Eliot blue plaque!!George Eliot, author, 1819-1880 wrote Middlemarch whilst living here in 1871

H. E. Bates blue plaque!!H. E. Bates author lived here from 1914 until 1931 when he married and moved to Little Chart, Kent

Richard Cameron and James Renwick blue plaque!!Cameron Monument. The monument opposite marks the original site of the Market Cross of Sanquhar. On 22nd June 1680, Richard Cameron and his followers rode into Sanquhar and affixed to the cross his declaration disowning Charles II as King
Robert Lochner blue plaque!!Robert Lochner MBE 1904-1965 inventor of the Mulberry Harbour floating breakwaters which supported the D-Day landings in june 1944 lived here from 1939 until his death

Ernest Rutherford blue plaque!!Ernest Rutherford (1871 - 1937) Nobel Laureate led this laboratory 1907 - 1919 herein discovered the nuclear atom, split the atom, and initiated the field of nuclear physics

Joshua Reynolds brass plaque!!Sir Joshua Reynolds, 16 July 1723 - 23 February 1792, Portrait Painter. As a student of Italian art, his work became increasingly classical under the influence of the Bolognese school

John Hunter brass plaque!!John Hunter, 13 February 1728 - 16 October 1793, Pioneer Anatomist and Surgeon. John Hunter was born in East Kilbride, Scotland in 1728. After an unremarkable childhood, he journeyed south to London to work as a disector {sic} for his brother William, a teacher of anatomy

Charlie Chaplin grey plaque!!Charles Spencer Chaplin 16 April 1889 - 25 December 1977 Comic Actor, Director and Producer Charlie Chaplin was born in Walworth, London into a music hall family

William Hogarth brass plaque!!William Hogarth, 10 November 1697 - 26 October 1764, Satirical Artist and Illustrator. Trained as an engraver, he depicted the unseemly behaviour of contemporaries in works like the 'Beggar's Opera' (1728) and the 'A Rake's Progress' (1732)
Joseph Sturge bronze plaque!!He laboured to bring freedom to the negro slave, the vote to British workmen and the promise of peace to a war-torn world

Shelagh Delaney bronze plaque!!Number 77 Duchy Rd The childhood home of Shelagh Delaney celebrated writer, proud Salfordian and cherished daughter, mother and grandma. 25.11.1938 - 20.11.2011

George Fox black plaque!!Quaker Meeting House. There has been a Meeting House on this site since 1677. The original building was replaced and enlarged in 1708 and forms the core of the present Meeting House, making it Lancaster's second oldest place of worship after the Priory Church

Robert Stephenson black plaque!!Robert Stephenson 1803-1859. Robert Stephenson & Company established in world's first purpose built locomotive factory, 1823. Designed & constructed -˜Locomotion No.1' in 1828, -˜Rocket' in 1829 and -˜Planet' in 1830.
Dudley North black plaque!!Dudley Third Lord North discovered the Chalybeate water here.
Abraham Darby blue plaque!!The Industrial Revolution. Abraham Darby 1678-1717. First Metallurgical Laboratory 1702, Casting iron in sand moulds 1707, Smelting iron with coke 1710.

George V black plaque!!This memorial was erected as part of the Queensway Tunnel Diamond Jubilee Celebrations in remembrance of those who died during it's construction. Isambard Kingdom Brunel blue plaque!!Engineer - Great Western Railway 1841. Isambard Brunel 1806-1859. SS Great Western 1838, SS Great Britain 1843, Thames Tunnel 1843, Royal Albert Bridge 1859, SS Great Eastern 1859, Clifton Bridge 1864

Henry Wood blue plaque!!The Church of the Holy Sepulchre known as St Sepulchre Without Newgate. Built on the site of a Saxon church dedicated to St Edmund the church became known as St Edmund and the Holy Sepulchre

Isambard Kingdom Brunel and Clifton Suspension Bridge stone plaque!!Isambard Kingdom Brunel 9th April 1806 - 15th September 1859 This tablet was set up by the Clifton Suspension Bridge Trust 15th September 1959

T. E. Lawrence green plaque!!Lawrence of Arabia 1888-1935. On this site in 1925 soldier and author T. E. Lawrence lodged whilst serving at RAF Cranwell. John Keats marble plaque!!The poet Keats resided here in 1818

Orcombe Point black plaque!!Local people stood on Orcombe Point to watch an English ship fight and beat a Dutch one in the bay in 1792. The Dutch dead were buried on Dawlish Warren and then haunted it for years...

George MacDonald plaque!!George MacDonald poet and novelist lived here 1867-1877
Joe Jenkins blue plaque!!Joe (You're All F*****g Barred) Jenkins 1929-2010 ex proprietor, poet, bon viveur & old git regularly swore at everybody on these premises

Henry VIII blue plaque!!King Henry VIII 1491-1547 Close to this site stood the King's Manor House. Part of its boundary wall adjoins Cheyne Studio
Orcombe Point black plaque!!During the Second World War the Home Guard operated two large guns at Orcombe Point to protect the coast. The men also practised throwing hand granades on the Point !

Orcombe Point black plaque!!The site stretches 155km (95 miles) from Orcombe Point to Studland Bay in Dorset. Every step you take along the coast transports you through more than a thousand years of geological time !

Joe Orton green plaque!!John Kingsley Orton (Joe Orton) 1933-1967 playwright lived here 1960-1967

H. G. Wells red plaque!!Herbert George Wells (1866-1946) H. G. Wells, the writer, lived in this district for several years. Between 1893 and 1894 he lived here and later, on his return from London, moved to 'The Avenue' in Worcester Park

Earth black plaque!!Erosion is a good thing ! It reveals the rock layers that record 185 million years of the Earth's history here, and creates the cliffs, beaches and landslips that make this coast to special

Jurassic Coast black plaque!!The South West Coast Path runs through Orcombe Point and the Jurassic Coast. This National Trail is over 1000km (630 miles) long, from Minehead in north Somerset to Poole Harbour in Dorset
Thomas Hardy stone plaque!!Thomas Hardy, O.M. was born in the adjacent cottage and in it wrote "Under the Greenwood Tree" and "Far from the Madding Crowd"

Jurassic Coast black plaque!!The site has many different landowners. The National Trust owns the most, with about a third of the coastal strip in its care

Robert Milligan bronze plaque!!To perpetuate the memory of Robert Milligan a Merchant of London, to whose genius, perseverance and guardian care the surrounding great work principally owes it's design, accomplishment and regulation

Thomas Mottershead plaque!!Sgt Thomas Mottershead VC DCM. Born here 17th January 1892 died with honour 12th January 1917. Pilot with Royal Flying Corps in WW1. He gave his life in service to his country & his fellow man.

Edwin Duncan Sandys green plaque!!Lord Duncan-Sandys 1908-1987 politician and statesman lived here 1945-1986

Lee Miller blue plaque!!Lee Miller Photographer 1907-1977 Lived here
Alfred Waterhouse black plaque!!Town Hall (1877) Victorian gothic style architect - Alfred Waterhouse (1830-1905)
Edward Salomons black plaque!!Spanish and Portuguese Synagogue 1874. A building with Spanish Saracenic motifs Architect Edward Salomons (1828-1906).
Little Ireland red plaque!!Site of Little Ireland. Large numbers of immigrant Irish workers lived here in appalling housing conditions. Built c.1827 vacated c.1847, demolished c.1877.
William Butterfield black plaque!!Building of special architectural or historic interest Grade 1, Church of Saint Cross (1866) Architect William Butterfield (1814-1900).
Louis Paulhan blue plaque!!Louis Paulhan (1883 - 1963) Pioneer French aviator landed a Farman biplane in a field on this site making the first London / Manchester flight, 28 April 1910.
John Thomas Smith plaque!!John Thomas Smith 1766 -1833 Artist and engraver lived at Myrtle Cottage on this site 1788 -“ 1795
Robert Howard Spring blue plaque!!Robert Howard Spring (1889-1965) journalist and novelist lived here 1920-1931

Thomas de la Warre and Humphrey Chetham black plaque!!Chetham's Hospital Manor House of Thomas de la Warre given to the Collegiate Church (now Cathedral) in 1421. In 1653 Humphrey Chetham founded a school and free public library
Daniel Adamson blue plaque!!Daniel Adamson (1820-1890) engineer, ironfounder and leading promoter of Manchester Ship Canal lived here.
Friedrich Engels blue plaque!!Friedrich Engels (1820 - 1895) social philosopher and writer lived at No 6 Thorncliffe Grove which once stood on this site
Joseph Jordan red plaque!!The site of the First Provincial School of Anatomy. Founded 1st October 1814 by Joseph Jordan (1787 - 1873).

Elizabeth Raffald plaque!!Elizabeth Raffald (1733 - 1781) Published the first street and trade directory of Manchester. Wrote one of the earliest cookery books. Started the first employment agency for domestic servants

Robert Owen blue plaque!!Robert Owen 1771-1858. Welsh entrepreneur and social reformer whose ideas formed the basis of the world-wide co-operative movement. Lived and worked in Manchester for 12 years working first in a business on this site c.1786

Thomas Wright blue plaque!!Thomas Wright 1789 - 1876 'The Prisoners' Friend' Born in Manchester and lived in Sidney Street. Dedicated his life to the relief of human suffering and in particular to the poor and needy of this City.

Charles Lamb and Mary Lamb black plaque!!Charles and Mary Lamb lived here
James Brydges and Minchenden House plaque!!Site of Minchenden House Home of 3rd Duke of Chandos demolished 1853
Edgar Wood blue plaque!!Edgar Wood (1860-1936) artist-architect designed this former First Church of Christ Scientist 1903
Daniel Adamson and Manchester Ship Canal blue plaque!!Lodge of 'The Towers' Daniel Adamson's home where the historic decision to build Manchester Ship Canal was taken 27 June 1882.
William Fairbairn plaque!!Sir William Fairbairn (1789 - 1874) Engineer, inventor of the riveting machine, designed the Lancashire Boiler and jointly set up the Mechanics Institute
Elizabeth Gaskell blue plaque!!Elizabeth Cleghorn Gaskell (1810 - 1865) Novelist and Authoress of 'Mary Barton', 'Cranford' and many other works lived here (1849 - 1865).

Frederick Marryat blue plaque!!Capt Frederick Marryat 1792-1848 Novelist was educated at -œHolmwood-? on this site

Bank of England blue plaque!!Built circa 1784, and known as 50 Salthouse Lane, this building was from 1828 a branch of the Bank of England. From 1860 it was used as a sailors' home and is now known as 105 Alfred Gelder Street.
Leigh Hunt blue plaque!!Leigh Hunt Poet Born on October 19th 1784 in a house on this site Died 1859

Lillian Bilocca blue plaque!!In recognition of the contribution to the fishing industry by the women of Hessle Road, led by Lillian Bilocca, who successfully campaigned for better safety measures, following the loss of three Hull trawlers in 1968.

Michael de la Pole, John Rochester, James Walworth, and The Charterhouse, Hull blue plaque!!Here, from its foundation by Sir Michael de la Pole in 1378, until 1539, stood the priory of Saint Michael. Called The Charterhouse the Carthusians John Rochester and James Walworth were detained here before their execution in 1537.

Henry Blogg black plaque!!Henry Blogg G.C. B.E.M. Coxswain of Cromer life-boats 1909-1947 Winner of the R.N.L.I. Gold Medal for Conspicuous Gallantry 3 times of its Silver Medal 4 times with the help of his gallant crew rescued 873 lives during 53 years of service - One of the bravest men who ever lived Died June 13th 1954
Thomas Hood plaque!!Thomas Hood 1799 -“ 1845 Poet & humourist Lived in Rose Cottage on this site
William Booth plaque!!William Booth (1829 -“ 1912) Founder of the S.A. lived here from 1903 until his death
Benjamin Waugh blue plaque!!In a house on this site lived Benjamin Waugh when in 1884 he founded the N.S.P.C.C. "The only voice which reached him was the cry of the child"
Charles Dickens blue plaque!!In this building in 1859 and 1860 the novelist Charles Dickens (1812-1870) gave selected readings from his many works
John Williams plaque!!Site of the Independent Congregation of Chapel 1789 -“ 1971 John Williams 1796 -“ 1839 Missionary was educated here

Monnow Bridge blue plaque!!Monnow Bridge built circa 1270, as a town defence, is the only surviving medieval bridge in Britain with the gate tower standing on the bridge. The gatehouse has served as a toll-house, guard room, gaol and dwelling house
Thomas Ferens blue plaque!!Businessman Liberal MP and Philanthropist Thomas R Ferens J P 1847-1930 This Art Gallery is one of his many benefactions

Robert Dudley and Alienation Office stone plaque!!In 1577 The Alienation Office was built here by Robert Dudley Earl of Leicester Master of the Office. His building was destroyed in the Great Fire of 1666

Isaac D'Israeli, Charles Cowden Clarke, and John Keats plaque!!In a house on this site Isaac D'Israeli 1766 -“ 1848 Author (Father of Benjamin D'Israeli) was born Charles Cowden Clarke 1787 -“ 1877 Author was born and John Keats Poet was educated (The house became Enfield's first railway station in 1849)
Alfred Gelder blue plaque!!A Hull architect and city improver who was mayor of Hull for five years Alfred Gelder designed this house and lived here from 1888 to 1903

Grace Darling and P. S. Forfarshire blue plaque!!This plaque commemorates the fateful voyage of the paddle steamer Forfarshire from Hull to Dundee on 5th September 1838. P. S. Robert Uvedale plaque!!Site of Enfield Palace 1522 -“ 1928 Robert Uvedale 1642 -“ 1722 Horticulturist Lived here 1670 - 1722

Alfred Gelder and Joseph Rank blue plaque!!The west elevation of this building incorporates part of Joseph Rank's mill (1891) designed by Alfred Gelder. Clarence Mill was important in the industrialisation of flour milling, bringing together steam power, large scale mechanisation and import of grain by water transport.
Alfred Tennyson blue plaque!!Alfred Lord Tennyson 1908-1892 Poet Laureate lived here
John Nash and Humphry Repton plaque!!"Grovelands" 1798 Designed by John Nash, Surrounding grounds laid out by Humphry Repton
Gary Cooper blue plaque!!Gary Cooper film star and Dunstable School pupil lived here 1910-1913
Hull College blue plaque!!A century of learning Hull College Park Street Centre has provided further education for the people of Hull since 1898
Kate Bunce blue plaque!!Kate Elizabeth Bunce (1856-1927) Prominent Birmingham artist of the Arts & Crafts Movement who, with her sister, Myra, created a fine reredos for a chapel in this church.
Francis Brett Young blue plaque!!Francis Brett Young 1884 - 1954 Novelist was at school here 1891 - 1895
Gerald Massey plaque!!Gerald Massey 1828 -“ 1907 Poet, Christian Socialist lived here 1877 - 1890

Humber Ferry blue plaque!!A ferry between Hull and Lincolnshire was first recorded in 1315. The Humber Ferry operated between here and New Holland from 1825 until the completion of the Humber Bridge in 1981.

Amy Johnson blue plaque!!Pioneer Aviator Amy Johnson (1903-1941) was born here 1st July 1903

Edgar Wallace bronze plaque!!Edgar Wallace Reporter Born London 1875 Died Hollywood 1931 Founder member of the Company of Newspaper Makers He knew wealth & poverty, yet had walked with kings & kept his bearing

William Wilberforce and Andrew Marvell blue plaque!!The Old Grammar School was built in 1583 and remained a school until 1878. Famous Old Boys include Andrew Marvell & William Wilberforce. This fine building became a museum in 1988

Thomas Tompion and George Graham blue plaque!!On this site lived two famous clockmakers Thomas Tompion F.R.S. "The Father of English Clockmaking" 1638-1713 and George Graham F.R.S. 1673-1751 both buried in Westminster Abbey

Edward Birchall blue plaque!!Carlton Hill Friends Meeting House Erected in 1868 was the principal Quaker Meeting House in Leeds. In 1921 it became Albrecht & Albrecht's clothing factory, the Quaker meetings removing to the schoolroom block to the rear, where worship continued until 1979
John Weld plaque!!Site of the Weld Chapel Build by Sir John Weld In 1615 (replaced by Christ Church 1862)

John French plaque!!John French 1st Earl of Ypres 1852 -“ 1925 Field Marshal lived at the Manor House near this site 1907 - 1918

Winifred Holtby and Land of Green Ginger blue plaque!!One of the oddest street names in the country, Land of Green Ginger was the title of a Winifred Holtby novel. The name's origin remains a mystery.
James Vashon blue plaque!!No. 29 Broad Street The birthplace and boyhood home of James Vashon 1742 - 1828 who joined the Navy as a Midshipman and rose to become Admiral of the White.
John Rogers blue plaque!!John Rogers Martyr Burned at the stake Feb 4th 1555

John Rogers and John Rogers Snr black plaque!!John Rogers, son of John Rogers, lorimer, was born in Deritend, c. 1505, assisted in the translation of the bible into English, and was burned at the stake on the 4th February 1555, first martyr of the Marian Persecution
Charles Lamb black plaque!!This house was occupied by Charles Lamb September 1827 until October 1829
John Keats and Thomas Hammond blue plaque!!On this site formerly stood the cottage in which the poet John Keats served his apprenticeship (1811 -“ 1815) to Thomas Hammond a surgeon of this parish
Wesleyan Assurance Society blue plaque!!Wesleyan Assurance Society was founded by members of the Wesleyan Chapel on this site in 1841
Herbert Howells black plaque!!Herbert Howells C.H., C.B.E., Composer was born in this house 17th Oct. 1892
Charles Coward blue plaque!!Charles Coward 1905 -“ 1976 Rescuer of prisoners from Auschwitz lived here 1945 - 1976

Rowland Hill blue plaque!!Sir Rowland Hill 1795-1879 Founder The World's First Uniform Postal Rate The Penny Post Lived in a Farmhouse now Horsehills Drive off Compton Road c1788-1802 Married Caroline Pearson St Peter's Church 1827
Jerome K. Jerome blue plaque!!The author of Three Men in a Boat Jerome K. Jerome was born in this house 2nd May 1859
Gladys Aylward plaque!!Gladys Aylward 1902 -“ 1970 Missionary to China and a pupil of this school AYLWARD SCHOOL
Alexander Fleming maroon plaque!!Sir Alexander Fleming 1881-1955 discovered penicillin in the second storey room above this plaque
Edith Cavell brown plaque!!Edith Cavell Executed in Belgium by German firing squad for assisting injured soldiers in World War I Assistant Matron at the Shoreditch Infirmary, 1903-1906

Richard Todd film cell plaque!!Richard Todd Resident Star Elstree Studios The Dam Busters and many others 1948-1962
Thomas Rich and Blue Coat Hospital, Gloucester blue plaque!!Here stood Blue Coat Hospital until 1889 founded 1668 endowed by Sir Thomas Rich

Worthing railway station blue plaque!!This building was opened by The London & South Coast Railway as the first Worthing station on November 25th 1845 Threatened with demolition in 1971 Later restored by Frank Sandell & Sons (Worthing) Limited in 1988
Oliver Heaviside blue plaque!!Oliver Heaviside Hon M.I.E.E. F.R.S. 1850-1925 Electrical engineer and mathematician lived here 1897-1909
John Henry Newman blue plaque!!John Henry Newman 1801-1890 Later Cardinal, lived here with his parents from 1816-1819

Edward Corvan black plaque!!Edward ('Ned') Corvan 1827-1865. Born in Liverpool, raised in Newcastle. Became Tyneside's first professional singer-songwriter following his debut at the Royal Olympic Concert Hall in 1853

Kenneth Armitage blue plaque!!Kenneth Armitage CBE sculptor. Born in Roundhay, he attended Leeds College of Art and the Slade School of Fine Art, London. International recognition followed his selection for the 1952 Venice Biennale

Maiden Lane Bridge bronze plaque!!Maiden Lane Bridge First built in 1819 to carry Maiden Lane across the Regent's Canal, it was widened and rebuilt in 1852 and 1923. In 1998 it was rebuilt to confirm to European Community legislation on minimum loading

Ernest Shackleton and Endurance blue plaque!!8th August 1914. Sir Ernest Shackleton, Polar Explorer, and his ship -˜Endurance' sailed from Millbay Docks at the start of the Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition (1914-17)

John Rylands and Enriqueta Rylands blue plaque!!John Rylands (1801-1888) Businessman and philanthropist of Longford Hall and his wife Enriqueta1843-1908 who founded the John Rylands Library in his memory.

James Scott white plaque!!A.D. MMIX This building stands on the site of the former coach-house of Monmouth House, constructed in 1681/2 for James, Duke of Monmouth, eldest illegitimate son of King Charles II, who was executed three years later following an abortive Rebellion.
Thomas Newcomen blue plaque!!Near this spot the world's first successful working steam engine was erected in 1712 by Thomas Newcomen 1663-1729 to pump water from the Coneygree Coalworks

Napoleon Bonaparte bronze plaque!!1815-2015 Napoleon, Emperor of the French, was detained on HMS Bellerophon in Plymouth Sound from 26 July to August 1815. Large crowds came to catch a glimpse of him

Sarah Storey brushed metal plaque!!This post box has been painted gold by Royal Mail to celebrate Sarah Storey Gold Medal winner London 2012 Paralympic Games Cycling: Road - Women's C5 Time Trial

Harold Falkner black plaque!!Harold Falkner (1875-1963) architect, lived and practised here from 1897 to 1963. His life's work was devoted to Farnham and he had a profound influence on the architectural style of the town centre in the first half of the 20th century.

Dante Gabriel Rossetti black plaque!!The Poet and Painter Dante Gabriel Rossetti (1828 - 1882) stayed here during 1860 prior to his wedding on 23rd. May, 1860 at nearby St. Clement's Church

James Brydges brown plaque!!'Canons' gate pillars Entrance gate piers to 'Canons' from Old Turnpike Road Built in 1712 for James Brydges 1673-1744, 1st Duke of Chandos. House demolished 1740 and existing buildings constructed from salvaged materials

Thomas Seymour and Catherine Parr bronze plaque!!KP Here lies Queen Katherine Parr wife to King Henry VIII and last the wife of Thomas Lord of Sudeley High Admiral of England and uncle to King Edward VI

William Penn brown plaque!!William Penn. The founder of Pennsylvania. Preached to a congregation of 3000 in 1685 from a window of The Crown. He was arrested but then released on the intervention of Bishop Kidder
Thomas Lawrence blue plaque!!Bear Hotel 1559. Sir Thomas Lawrence lived here 1773-1781
Charles Scott Sherrington blue plaque!!Sir Charles Scott Sherrington OM PRS 1857-1952 Neurophysiologist, histologist and Nobel Laureate in 1932. Educated here 1871-1876
Henry Tandey blue plaque!!Henry Tandey VC DCM MM 1891-1977 most decorated private soldier in World War I. Born at a house near this site

Eve Balfour, Alice Debenham, and Soil Association blue plaque!!Lady Eve Balfour OBE 1898-1990 & Alice Debenham 1867-1940 researched organic growing & nutrition here 1939-1971. Headquarters of the Soil Association 1946-1985

Larcum Kendall blue plaque!!Larcum Kendall 1719-“1790 celebrated watchmaker appointed by the Board of Longitude to make chronometers used by Captain Cook and Bligh in the South Seas lived near here as a child
Richard III black plaque!!Near this spot, on August 22nd 1485, at the age of 32, King Richard III fell fighting gallantly in defence of his realm & his crown against the usurper Henry Tudor

Royal Aero Club, Eustace Short, Oswald Short, Horace Short, and 1 other!!Mussel Manor & Shellbeach Aerodrome. Flying ground of the Aero Club, chosen 1909 by the Short brothers for the world's first aircraft factory, building Wright brothers' "Flyers"
Richard Lewis blue plaque!!Richard Lewis CBE 1914-1990 international opera and concert singer (tenor) teacher and conductor lived here from 1983 to 1990

Abraham Laverton, W. J. Stent, and Prospect Square, Westbury blue plaque!!Prospect Square Built by Abraham Laverton (1869), mainly for workers evicted for voting for him in an election. The case helped the campaign for The Secret Ballot Act (1872)

Abraham Laverton, W. J. Stent, and The Laverton Institute blue plaque!!The Laverton Institute Built 1873 by Abraham Laverton, for public use; hall, reading room and school. WJ Stent architect. Town council offices from 1974
Charles Hallé and Ford Madox Brown blue plaque!!Charles Halle (1819-1895) musician and conductor, Ford Madox Brown (1821-1893) pre-raphaelite artist lived here

Watersheddings blue plaque!!Watersheddings Rugby Ground. On the site of the housing development to the east of this park was the famous Watersheddings rugby ground, which served the Oldham club from its opening on the 28th September 1889, until the last first team match on the 19th January 1997

Charlotte Brontë and Patrick Brontë blue plaque!!Charlotte Brontë (1816 - 1855) In 1846 The Revd. Patrick Brontë came to Manchester for a cataract operation accompanied by his daughter Charlotte. They took lodgings at 59 Boundary Street West (formerly known as 83 Mount Pleasant) It was here that Charlotte began to write her first successful novel Jane Eyre

Tyldesley Rugby League Football Club and Oldham Roughyeds Rugby League Football Club blue plaque!!On this site on 21st September 1895, Oldham played their first home game under the rules of Rugby League (then known as the Northern Union) Oldham 3pts V Tyldesley 11pts
William Smith green plaque!!William Smith 1769-1839 "Father of English Geology" made the first map of an entire country -England and Wales- in 1815 lived on this site 1804-1819
Richard Cobden blue plaque!!Richard Cobden MP a pioneer of free trade lived here 1834-1843. Owens College (later Manchester University) occupied the building 1851-1873

Coventry Theatre  black plaque!!The Coventry Theatre The New Hippodrome, as it was originally named, was opened on 1 November 1937. It was the third Hippodrome on this site, the first situated in Pool Meadow (1903) and the second (1907) built in what is now the lower part of Lady Herbert's Garden

Andrew Carnegie blue plaque!!Carnegie Birthplace On 25th November 1835, Andrew Carnegie was born in this humble 17th century weaver's cottage. The Carnegie family lived in one room upstairs and another family lived in the adjoining cottage

Samuel Chadwick blue plaque!!Samuel Chadwick (1860-1932) Methodist Evangelist & Principal of Cliff College, President of the Methodist Conference, 1919, born, Burnley 16th September, 1860, Sunday school scholar & preacher, Wesley Chapter, Burnley
John Barlow plaque!!Professor John Barlow 1815-1856
Andrew Carnegie plaque!!Andrew Carnegie Birthplace Museum Andrew Carnegie, millionaire and philanthropist, was born in this cottage on the 25th November 1835.

7 July 2005 London bombings, Michael Stanley Brewster, Jonathan Downey, David Foulkes, and 3 other!!In memory of those who were killed in the bomb attack on a Circle line train near this station on 7th July 2005 Michael Stanley Brewster, Jonathan Downey, David Foulkes, Colin Morley, Jennifer Vanda Ann Nicholson, Laura Susan Webb

Isaac Newton and Orange Street Congregational Church, London white plaque!!Orange Street Congregational Church This church was founded in 1693 by Huguenot refugees who fled from France at the time of the Revocation of the Edict of Nantes

Frank Whittle bronze plaque!!Air Commodore Sir Frank Whittle OM, KBE, CB, FRS, FRAes. This statue celebrates the centenary of Frank Whittle's birth in Coventry and shows him watching the first test flight of a jet-propelled Gloster-Whittle E28/39 on 15 May 1941 at RAF Cranwell

Henry Royce and Rolls-Royce red plaque!!Henry Royce (1863 - 1933) established his world-renowned tradition of engineering excellence at Cooke Street in the 1880s. The first Rolls-Royce car was built here in 1904.
John Hay Beith plaque!!John Hay Beith ('Ian Hay') (1876 - 1952) Novelist and playwright born at Platt Abbey on this site 17th April 1876.
Charles Hallé plaque!!Sir Charles Halle 1819-1895 founder of the world-renowned orchestra lived from (1858 - 1895) at No.70 Greenheys Lane, which stood on this site.
Alliott Verdon Roe blue plaque!!Sir Alliott Verdon Roe (1877-1958). The first Englishman to fly an aircraft of his own design and construction 8th June 1908. Opened a workshop here 1st January 1910.
Hannah Mitchell blue plaque!!Hannah Maria Mitchell 1871 - 1956 radical suffragist, City Councillor and Magistrate lived here.

Court of Chancery of the County Palatine of Lancaster red plaque!!The Court of Chancery of the County Palatine of Lancaster founded in or before 1351 sat here from 1962 until replaced by the High Court, Chancery Division on 1st January 1972.
Henry Peach Robinson blue plaque!!Henry Peach Robinson (1830-1901) pioneer photographer lived and worked here

Widnes Vikings Rugby League Football Club and Leeds Rhinos Rugby League Football Club blue plaque!!On this site on 14th September 1895, Widnes played their first home game under the rules of Rugby League (then known as the Northern Union) Widnes v Leeds

Godiva and Leofric blue plaque!!Godiva, Lady of Coventry (died 10th September 1067) and her husband Leofric, Earl of Mercia (died 28th September 1057) were buried here in the church of Benedictine monastery they founded in 1043 on the site of St Osburg's nunnery, sacked by the Danes in 1016
Frank Woolley blue plaque!!Site of the birthplace of Frank Woolley Kent and England cricketer 1887 - 1978
Emily Davison white plaque!!Emily Davison heroine of the Women's Suffrage Movement was cared for here 1913
Siegfried Bettmann blue plaque!!Elm Bank. Founder of the Triumph companies Siegfried Bettmann (1863-1951) Mayor of Coventry 1913-14 lived here
William Amey blue plaque!!William Amey VC MM (1881-1940) holder of the Victoria Cross lived here
William Harrison Ainsworth black plaque!!Wm. Harrison Ainsworth 1805-1883 novelist was born in a house which stood on this site.
Ellen Wilkinson blue plaque!!Ellen Wilkinson (1891-1947) Stateswoman and Cabinet Minister, was born at 41 Coral Street on this site.

William Turton blue plaque!!William Turton Corn and hay merchant here at Turton's Wharf and Warehouse rebuilt 1876. He pioneered horse drawn tramways across northern England. From 1866 he ran omnibuses in Leeds, becoming a founding director, then chairman, of Leeds Tramways Company 1872-1895

Robert Blackburn and Olympia Works blue plaque!!The Olympia Works. Robert Blackburn, aviator pioneer, built aircraft here including over 100 BE2C army and navy biplanes and the famous Kangeroo, Swift and Sopwith Baby planes
Frank Kidson blue plaque!!Frank Kidson MA 1855-1926 Musical antiquarian and folk-song collector lived here 1904-1926

Philosophical Hall blue plaque!!The Philosophical Hall. The imposing home of the Leeds Philosophical and Literary Society stood here until 1966. Erected in 1821 it became the centre of scientific and cultural life in Leeds, housing a fine museum conveyed to the City in 1921.

Leeds & County Liberal Club, Charles Roberts Chorley, and John Wreghitt Connon blue plaque!!Leeds & County Liberal Club From Parliamentary and municipal reform in the 1830s to 1894 the Liberal Party dominated politics in Leeds. This splendid club in Welsh terracotta opened in 1891

Walt Whitman black plaque!!"All architecture is what you do to it when you look upon it' W.W. J.W. Wallace founder of the 'Eagle Street College' dedicated to the works of Walt Whitman spent his working life here 1867 - 1912
Danny Blanchflower blue plaque!!Danny (Robert Dennis) Blanchflower 1926-1993 footballer and journalist lived here
Walter Tull plaque!!Walter Tull born 28th April 1888 died 25th March 1918 began his career here at Clapton FC season of 1908-09

John White black plaque!!In memory of the Ghost of White Hart Lane John Anderson White 1937-1963 struck by lightening whilst playing this hole. Spurs and Scotland. All glory comes from daring to begin
Reg Presley blue plaque!!Reg Presley 1941-2013 singer/songwriter The Troggs performed here 1964-1965

Magnus Magnusson bronze plaque!!Action for Birds 100 years This plaque is to celebrate the Centenary of The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds The unveiling was performed by the Society's President Magnus Magnusson on 17th February 1989 at the Croft where the Society was founded one hundred years ago The occasion marked one hundred years (1889-1989) of achievements in the conservation of wild birds and the environment.
Ava Gardner bronze plaque!!In loving memory of Ava Gardner, 1922-1990. Carmen and Morgan

Walter Tull plaque!!In memory of Walter Tull 1888-1918 born in Folkestone and educated at Munfella Primary School he was the first black officer in the British Army and the first black outfield player to play professional football in Britain

Percy Bysshe Shelley and Mary Shelley blue plaque!!Percy Bysshe Shelley 1792-1822 poet & radical thinker & Mary Shelley 1797-1851 author of Frankenstein lived in a house on this site 1815-16

Brig o' Balgownie bronze plaque!!Brig o' Balgownie. This bridge, one of the oldest in Britain, was completed about 1320 supposedly at the behest of King Robert the Bruce. It has a gothic shaped arch with a clear span of some 12 metres and is built of a mixture of sandstone and granite
John Skinner Prout blue plaque!!John Skinner Prout 1805-1876 Artist and Lithographer Lived here 1838 to 1840
William Henry Hunt blue plaque!!William Henry (Bird's Nest) Hunt

Grammar School of Aberdeen stone plaque!!On the school hill stood the Grammar School of Aberdeen for over six centuries. This stone marks the site of the school from 1757 to 1863 when the present building in Skene Street was erected
Dodie Smith blue plaque!!Dodie Smith 1895-1990 author and playwright lived here

Thomas Blake Glover and Glover House, Aberdeen green plaque!!Glover House. In recognition of the great contribution made by Mr. Thomas Blake Glover during the late 19th century to the foundation of modern Japanese industry, we donate this house to the Grampian-Japan Trust
Mary Garden stone plaque!!This garden was planted in memory of Mary Garden the famous opera singer who lived near here at Belgrave Terrace
Laurence Gomme blue plaque!!Sir Laurence Gomme 1853-1916 clerk to the London County Council, folklorist and historian lived here 1895-1909
Alexander Cruden grey plaque!!Alexander Cruden 1699-1770 Master of Arts, Marischal College, Compiler of the Concordance to the Bible, was born in a house in Cruden's Court near this spot

Robert Burns black plaque!!Founded by James Chalmers in January 1748 as the "Aberdeen's Journal" and originally printed and published at an office on the north side of Castle Street, this firm occupied premises in Broad Street from 1894 to 1970
Frank Matcham green plaque!!Frank Matcham (1854-1920) theatre architect designed this theatre
Constance Naden blue plaque!!Constance C. W. Naden 1858-1889 poet, scientist and philosopher lived here for most of her life
George Jamesone bronze plaque!!George Jamesone 1588-1644 artist

George Grossmith blue plaque!!George Grossmith 1847-1912 actor and author lived here

Samuel Seabury stone plaque!!This tablet is by permission of the authorities of this university erected by churchmen of Connecticut to preserve the memory of the place in Long Acre very near this spot where on the 14th November 1784 Samuel Seabury was consecrated the first bishop of the church in America.

Archibald Simpson stone plaque!!Archibald Simpson architect 1790-1847 a pioneer of civic design in this his native city (was born here)
Robert Service blue plaque!!Robert William Service 1874-1958 poet of the Yukon and socialist was born in a house near this site
William Willett green plaque!!William Willett 1856-1915 builder and originator of Daylight Saving Time lived here 1882-1894

George Formby Snr blue plaque!!George Formby Snr, 1875-1921, Music hall's legendary comic genius and father of George Formby Jnr was born James Booth at 26 Hodgson Street, Ashton-under-Lyne, Remembered by the people of Tameside and the George Formby Society
Alison Uttley blue plaque!!The Old Vicarage. This house was donated by will in 1718 to be used as a vicarage. Around 1910 Alison Uttley countrywoman and childrens' writer lived here.

Horatio Nelson blue plaque!!Lord Nelson visited Ross in 1802 and walked through these gardens.
Alison Uttley blue plaque!!Alison Uttley 1884-1976 author of The Country Child and Little Grey Rabbit born here and inspired by these surroundings

Nigel Gresley blue plaque!!Sir Nigel Gresley 1876-1941 pioneering railway engineer designed the Mallard and Flying Scotsman steam locomotives. Advanced the modernisation of Britain's railway network

George Skene stone plaque!!This house formerly the town residence of Sir George Skene Provost of Aberdeen 1676 to 1685 restored by the corporation of the city of Aberdeen was opened on the thirtieth day of September one thousand nine hundred and fifty three by her majesty Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother
David Letterman blue plaque!!David Letterman American talk show host (born April 12th, 1947) got drunk here for a week

William Scoresby blue plaque!!The Rev. William Scoresby D.D. 1789-1857 Yorkshireman; Arctic Explorer; Scientist; Author "The Arctic Regions." Vicar of Bradford 1839-1847. Founded first Church Day Schools in Bradford
John Lennon and George Harrison blue plaque!!John Lennon MBE 1940-1980 George Harrison MBE 1943-2001 worked here

Hugh Miller brown plaque!!Hugh Miller (1802 - 1856) geologist and naturalist, writer and folklorist Hugh Miller edited The Witness newspaper at 297 High Street from 15 January 1840 until his death on 24th December 1856 "Life is itself a school, and nature always a fresh study"
Laura Ashley black plaque!!Laura Ashley 1925-1985 Designer was born here. Cynllunwraig a anwyd yma

Felix Mendelssohn stone plaque!!Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy born at Hamburg 1809 died 1847, composed "The Rivulet" in 1829 while visiting Mr Henry Taylor who rented Coed-Du. Charles Kingsley born at Holne Vicarage, Devon, 1819, died 23rd Jany 1875, frequently walked along "The Leet".

Edward I stone plaque!!This fragment is the remains of the building where King Edward I held his parliament A.D. 1283 in which was passed the statute of Rhuddlan securing to the principality of Wales its judicial rights and independence.

Jem Mace blue plaque!!Jem Mace 1831-1910 Referred to as the Father of Modern Boxing, Jem Mace became World Heavyweight Champion in 1870 and subsequently became landlord of the White Swan from which Swan Lane takes its name.
